review_content: Cool looking can but it really stops there. You would be much better off just buying normal Asahi, possibly worth one try

aroma is malt, alcohol. darker golden with no head. taste is a good melding of hops and malt heaviness, some fresh flavours pop out along with caramel popcorn. palate is good. this is a kick ass value beer at 6%.

Can in Nikko, Japan.
Pours clear amber with a decent white head.
Poor aroma with some odd and off-notes. 
The flavor is much better but only mediocre, at best.
Medium-light body and medium+ carbonation.

Pours a clear golden yellow from the can with huge fluffy white head that dissipates slowly to leave light lace. Aroma of clean corn and light biscuit notes, lager crispness. Taste follows, clean and light. It's another macro lager, not bad, but nothing special.
Got in Tokyo. Pours clear light golden with a white head. The aroma is grainy sweet with grass. Flavor is grainy sweet with a grassy and dry bite.
Can. Clear pale color without head. Aroma - Malt, corn, urine from the train of the Czech Railways. Taste - Lightly bitter, light sweetness, some fruit, grain.

Can at home in Hackney - sourced from Japan. Pours totally clear yellow with a fine, foamy white head. Nice aroma, just simple pale cereal grains. Light sweet flavour, subtly bready, nips of biscuits, minimal bitterness. Light to medium bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Decent balance in the finish, a little syrup note, more simple bread, cereal grains, soft hay. Not bad for a macro. Easy-drinking.

F: average, white, quick gone.
C: gold, clear.
A: malt, metallic, cardboard, corn, papery, light vegetables. 
T: malt, huge irony, dry grassy bitterness on the palate, corn, hint of caramel, medium body, medium carbonation, hard to average and taste is a little better than the nose, 500ml can from E-Mart near Incheon airport in Seoul.

35 cl can, happoshu. Golden color, clear, soapy head that fades quickly, fizzy. Aroma is mild grainy, biscuit, iron, solvent. Taste is sweetish with a metallic bitterness, alcohol is noticeable in the finish. Relatively decent if compared to industry standard macro lagers, cheap booze.
Can. Darker golden, no head. Malty but a bit grainy, too. Ok macrobrew. Tremendous stuff, really.

Can 35cl / Lata 35cl.
@ MaxValu Taiko, Nagoya, Japon.
A: Golden / Dorado.
T/S: Cereal, sweet / Cereal, dulce.
If you can ignore the atrocious skunky smell and awful flavor, they actually pull off the other qualities of a beer quite well.
Malty aroma. Taste is thin and tasteless. Little bitterness that disappears quickly. Watery and useless beer to drink. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

350 ml can. Pours clear golden, nice white head that goes down soon but still maintains a thin layer for a while. Lively carbonation. Aroma has vegetables, wet cardboard, nothing nice or enjoyable. Taste is unpretentious, pretty much nothing there besides surprisingly sweet and (artificially?) malty finish. Have had worse beer than this, not great but not the worst either.

Can from Lawson. Next to no aroma, but mildly surprised by the half-decent body and middling mouthfeel. The tiniest of upgrades on the Clear Asahi monstrosity, it has a faint tang of hops over the standard daisan beer mix of veggies and metho. Not a prime beer by any stretch of the imagination.
Cool looking can but it really stops there. You would be much better off just buying normal Asahi, possibly worth one try

aroma is malt, alcohol. darker golden with no head. taste is a good melding of hops and malt heaviness, some fresh flavours pop out along with caramel popcorn. palate is good. this is a kick ass value beer at 6%.

F: average, white, quick gone. C: gold, clear.…
